# Chord: 6th in C# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 6th chord in C# consists of the notes C#, E#, G#, and A#. This chord is constructed by stacking notes in intervals of a major 3rd and a minor 3rd. In the key of C#, the 6th chord adds a rich and harmonic flavor to musical compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (Root)
- E# (Major 3rd)
- G# (Perfect 5th)
- A# (Major 6th)

The intervals between the notes are as follows:
- Root to Major 3rd: Major 3rd (4 semitones)
- Major 3rd to Perfect 5th: Minor 3rd (3 semitones)
- Perfect 5th to Major 6th: Major 3rd (4 semitones)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 6th chord in C# can be found in various genres such as jazz, R&B, funk, and soul. In these genres, this chord adds a soulful and jazzy flavor to the music, providing a smooth and warm sound to compositions. It is often used to create a mellow and sultry atmosphere in songs.
